result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Doro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, cash bail to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to probable cause for arrest.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John C Doro in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Correction to entry made on 05/14/2015.  On motion of the State Court amended Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct contray with Wis Stats. 947.01(1).

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Dana D.

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Participate in family counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant John C Doro in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 947.01 and 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letters from The Nevermore Batters Intervention Program received and filed.

Defendant John C Doro in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM017881  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/05/2015

Remaining bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dana D.

Defendant John C Doro in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-067
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for John C Doro
Current: 300 S Honeycreek Dr., Milwaukee, WI 53214   (Effective: 04-07-2015)
Prior: 5512 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/7/15 @ 1:30pm
